chapter.title: Commands
chapter.para: This chapter is designed to serve as a reference to the commands that are implemented in the MPX operating system. Similar information may also be obtained through the built-in "help" command.

section.title: date
section.para: When given an optional -s option followed by a valid date string, [date string], the date will be set to the specified date.

section.title: display
section.para: Displays the contents of the current working directory.
Optionally accepts a relative or absolute directory path to function on.

section.title: exit
section.para: The exit command will terminate the MPX operating system. There are no additional arguments that may be passed to this command. This is the safest way to end your MPX session. You will be prompted for confirmation before you are dropped.

section.title: help
section.para: The help command will print out a list of commands and a brief description of each. This is a very useful command to those unfamiliar with the system.

section.title: history
section.para: The history command will print out a list of the user's previous commands.

section.title: version
section.para: The version command will print out the current version, including the version number, date of release, and the first several digits of the git commit, which is the source control for tours de force.
